SECRET.
G.T.5580
BATTLE SITUATION - NOON - 2nd SEPTEMBER, 1918.
1. WESTERN FRONT.
British Front.
We attacked this morning with the 1st and 3rd Armies astride the ARRAS - CAMBRAI ROAD and our troops are reported to be in DURY and on the western edge of CAGNICOURT. Stiff fighting is going on on the high ground north of DURY. This fighting has taken our troops across the DROCOURT - QUEANT line. On the Canadian Corps front alone 7 enemy Divisions have been identified in this fighting.
Further south we have captured RIENCOURT-LES-CAGNICOURT and our troops are moving south-east from there round to the north-east of QUEANT.
Further south we have captured NOREUIL and VILLERS-AU-FLOS and our troops are advancing on ROCQUIGNY. During the night we captured SAILLY-SAILLISEL and SAILLISEL.
In RIENCOURT-LES-CAGNICOURT we took 350 prisoners and in the attack further north a large number of prisoners have already been counted.
In the LYS salient we have taken NEUVE-EGLISE.
French Front.
There is nothing to report.
2. ITALIAN FRONT. There is no change in the situation.
3. MACEDONIAN FRONT. At 5-30 p.m. on 1st September British troops attacked the enemy's salient north of AL?AKMAH (west of the VARDAR). All objectives are reported to have been taken and some prisoners captured.
?ral Staff,
?ar Office, S.W.1.
2nd September, 1918.
? at 1 p.m.
